summary: This document is a criminal history record (rap sheet) produced by the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services in response to an FBI request. It appears to be a delayed response providing additional sentencing information, likely related to an individual involved in the Epstein case, though the subject's identity is not explicitly stated in the provided text.

persons.name: Michael C. Green
persons.role: Executive Deputy Commissioner of the NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services
persons.context: Listed as the executive deputy commissioner of the agency producing the criminal history record in response to the FBI request.

events.title: Criminal History Record Production
events.description: The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services produces and transmits a criminal history record (rap sheet) in response to an FBI request for additional sentencing information.

locations: Alfred E. Smith Building, 80 South Swan St., Albany, New York 12210
keyFacts: The document is a criminal history record (rap sheet) produced on October 6, 2021.
It was generated by the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services in response to an FBI request originating from the State of Florida.
The request specifically sought 'ADDITIONAL SENTENCING INFORMATION' that 'MAY BE AVAILABLE FROM ORIGINATING AGENCY'.
The record contains standard caveats about its use and indicates it is a 'multi-source offender record'.
The subject of the rap sheet is not named in the provided text, suggesting the identifier may be on a page not included in this excerpt.
